channel.title: Radio TMI
channel.managingEditor: radio-tmi@solidgoldstudios.co.za (Toastmasters International | Solid Gold Podcast Studios)
channel.description:
Are you a leader? An aspiring public speaker? Perhaps you are working on building you strategic planning skills, management skills or overall confidence! Toastmasters International offers educational programs and leadership opportunities that build these transferable skills to an extent of creating a podcast show, leading from the forefront or winning an international public speaking contest.

Radio TMI is a project created by the participants of the Advanced Future Leaders Program and is an initiative of the Toastmasters Leadership Institute of Toastmasters International District 74. The program was lead by Frank Tsuro, A past District Director of Southern Africa. Radio TMI serves as a host channel for various programs in which each participant produces their own content.

If you wish to learn more about Toastmasters, its transferable skills, the people making history in Southern Africa as well as the success stories and insights from various divisions of Toastmasters District 74, this is the channel for you.

Recorded and produced at https://SolidGoldStudios.co.za #BeHeard

item.author: radio-tmi@solidgoldstudios.co.za (Toastmasters International | Solid Gold Podcast Studios)
item.itunes:author: Toastmasters International | Solid Gold Podcast Studios
item.title: Toastmasters Youth Leadership Program | Denise Santos
item.itunes:title: Toastmasters Youth Leadership Program | Denise Santos
item.itunes:subtitle: A preventable social issue
item.description:
Radio TMI - Where Leaders Talk In this first episode of the program ""Cappuccino Catch-ups and Meaningful Mochas"" Teresa Huber of Zimbabwe interviews Denise Santos (a specialist in sociology, gender and gender transformation) on teenage pregnancies, a preventable social issue. Teresa plans to introduce the Toastmasters International Youth Leadership Program to schools in her community in Zimbabwe.


https://www.facebook.com/groups/toastmasters74membersgroup/ 1

Music Used : Myk Nich | Soundcloud.com/myknich


Engage with us on Facebook http://www.facebook.com/RadioTMI/


If you're ready to produce your own podcast, contact the podcast experts at SolidGoldStudios.co.za

item.author: radio-tmi@solidgoldstudios.co.za (Toastmasters International | Solid Gold Podcast Studios)
item.itunes:author: Toastmasters International | Solid Gold Podcast Studios
item.title: TLI - What, Why, How? | Enias Chingwe (Distinguished Toastmaster | TLI Division H Coordinator), Kirstin Bosworth (TLI Trainer and facilitator)
item.itunes:title: TLI - What, Why, How? | Enias Chingwe (Distinguished Toastmaster | TLI Division H Coordinator), Kirstin Bosworth (TLI Trainer and facilitator)
item.itunes:subtitle: Learn Why and How Leaders Are Trained in Toastmasters International
item.description:
Welcome to Coffee With Toastmasters by Radio TMI. In this launch episode, podcast series host Wendy Khumalo and co-host Vusi Maupa introduce the Toastmasters Leadership Institute, a leadership and development body in Toastmasters International District 74, Southern Africa. Kirstin Bosworth, accredited TLI trainer and facilitator defines a Toastmasters Leadership Institute trainer and their involvement in the training of club officers and enhancement of Toastmasters clubs across the Southern African region. She shares the rewards of servant leadership in Toastmasters International and gives her counsel to aspiring TLI trainers in the district. During this segment of the episode, Enias Chingwe (DTM), Immediate Past Area Director and TLI Division H Coordinator talks about his role in the Toastmasters Leadership Institute and the challenges faced by this development body. He also encourages Toastmasters to take one step forward and shares his passion for people. Club officer training programs ensure that club leaders are well trained and achieve club performance goals. Vusi Maupa, co-host, discusses the club officer training program, its design and objectives. Enias Chingwe and Kirstin Bosworth both describe the preparation that goes into training club leaders for excellence. Wendy Khumalo distinguishes between club officer training one and two as well as the benefits of attending both trainings. She also shares the club officer training dates for 2020 which are free and open to the public across Southern Africa. Club officer training is happening now! Visit the Toastmasters 74 website to check your area’s next club officer training date on the district calendar. Toastmasters International District 74 is ready to host you!! Radio TMI, Where leaders talk.


https://www.toastmasters74.org/tli/ 3

https://www.toastmasters74.org/district-calendar/ To learn more about the Toastmasters Leadership Institute in district 74, please visit this link.

To view the district calendar for Club Officer training dates and other TLI events, click on this link.

Music Used : Myk Nich


Engage with us on Facebook http://www.facebook.com/RadioTMI/


If you're ready to produce your own podcast, contact the podcast experts at SolidGoldStudios.co.za
